results.firPara: Continuing our A-league preview series, our football writers give their verdicts on the four teams they believe will be among the mid-table melee
results.secPara: Roars tumultuous off-season raised concerns for many about their on-field chances; but in fairness we saw some of this last pre-season and Brisbane went within a whisker of finishing premiers.
results.webTitle: A-League season preview part II: Brisbane, Perth, Adelaide and Sydney

results.firPara: Without wishing to patronise the players of Chelsea Ladies, all of whom have experienced the glamour and prestige of playing on the grandest stages, it is hard not to frame the Champions League game against Wolfsburg on Wednesday night as a major step in the right direction given that they have never played at Stamford Bridge.
results.secPara: The way Gilly Flaherty tells it, the teams main focus will be on wiping out the disappointment of relinquishing their grip on the Super League title last week, while there is also a chance to gain revenge for the defeat against Wolfsburg in this competition last season. Yet Chelseas vice-captain acknowledges that the opportunity to play a Champions League tie in one of the most recognisable stadiums in England, with its silky playing surface and plush facilities, is a landmark moment for the womens game.
results.webTitle: Chelsea Ladies relish welcoming Wolfsburg to Stamford Bridge

results.firPara: • Song set to be transferred to hospital in Paris for more treatment
results.secPara: Rigobert Song, the former Liverpool, West Ham United and Cameroon defender, is set to fly to France for more treatment after coming out of a coma.
results.webTitle: Former Liverpool defender Rigobert Song out of coma after suffering stroke

results.firPara: Bob Bradley has said his appointment as Swansea City coach is a special opportunity for him – but also for US football.
results.secPara: Bradley, 58, will become the first American to coach in the Premier League when it was confirmed on Monday he would replace Francesco Guidolin in south Wales.
results.webTitle: Bob Bradley says Swansea job a 'special opportunity' for US football

results.firPara: When England came calling, there was only one thing Oliver Burke could say. He was preparing to make his debut for Scotland and it was the first he had been told of any interest from the Football Association when he heard, at second hand, there were two nations courting his allegiance.
results.secPara: Englands curiosity was valid – Burke was born in Kirkcaldy but moved to Melton Mowbray with his English mother as an infant – but the horse had bolted and within days he would be appearing for Gordon Strachans side towards the end of a 1-0 win over Denmark.
results.webTitle: Oliver Burke: ‘England tried a cheeky one but no way! I love playing for Scotland – goosebumps’

results.firPara: Pep Guardiola has blocked his Manchester City players from using the internet at the clubs training base in a drive to foster more face-to-face communication and a greater team spirit.
results.secPara: The Spaniard has arranged for certain areas of the City Football Academy to be free from 3G signal and disconnected from the in-house Wi-Fi system.
results.webTitle: It’s good to talk: Pep Guardiola blocks Wi-Fi at Manchester City training base

results.firPara: In todays Fiver England, distractions in Ghana, and hardbag at Hampden
results.secPara: In todays Fiver England, distractions in Ghana, and hardbag at Hampden
results.webTitle: The Fiver | 'You Gareth Southgate, you England penalty drama!'

results.firPara: Cardiff City have sacked their manager Paul Trollope after a poor start to their Championship season. The Welsh club are next to bottom of the table after their latest defeat to Burton Albion on Saturday.
results.secPara: The 44-year-old succeeded Russell Slade in the summer but has lasted just 12 matches this season and has paid the price for a disappointing start to the campaign.
results.webTitle: Cardiff City sack manager Paul Trollope following poor start to season

results.firPara: A 13-year-old midfielder who has caught the attention of Brendan Rogers has made his debut for Celtics under-20 team.
results.secPara: Karamoko Dembélé came on as a substitute in the 3-1 victory over Hearts in the SPFL Development League at Mortons Cappielow Park ground.
results.webTitle: Celtic’s 13-year-old starlet Karamoko Dembélé makes debut for U20s

results.firPara: England Under-17 side finished the Croatia Cup in style with an 8-1 victory over Germany in their third game of the tournament.
results.secPara: Steve Coopers team beat Greece and the hosts Croatia last week but they saved their best performance for last. Manchester Uniteds Angel Gomes opened the scoring in the fourth minute, with Jadon Sancho of Manchester City doubling the advantage four minutes later.
results.webTitle: England Under-17s crush Germany 8-1 in final Croatia Cup match
